column1: DYN1_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Wangchuck
column2: the Dragon Emperors. Their rule has lasted in an unbroken line since hundreds of years before The Deluge. Even if their isolationist policy and stagnant way of doing things have made them averse to change
column4: they are still without a doubt the rulers of the most advanced civilization of the Old World
column5: which was kept this way for centuries partially thanks to their wise rule;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN2_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Strhongboarh
column2: the dynasty that shaped Britannia into the great Empire it became
column3: and by extent influenced the entire post-Event Western Europe. Under their rule Britannia would conquer Ireland and vassalize the Kingdom of Scotland. They would also organize the expedition for France which would not only extend the reach of Britannia further
column4: but also be the final nail in the coffin for the Novelist Empire of Numernor
column5: causing their rapid downfall and fragmentation. Truly the most influential dynasty of Post-Event Europe.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN3_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Kirtoka. Founders of the Transnistrian Empire
column2: the Kirtoka rose from mere rulers of a small domain on the Black Sea to one of the first Imperial Dynasties after the Event. The house however
column3: like many others in it’s time
column4: went past it’s apogee and disappeared forever.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN4_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Cyflymarhyan
column2: the British Emperors that would actually launch the Expedition for France prepared by house Strhongboarh. Under their military lead
column3: Britannia would shatter the High Kingdom of Numenor and establish the Governorate of Britanny
column4: which would come to rule most of Northern France. As such
column5: they are the British house directly responsible for destroying the High Kingdom for good in addition to expanding Britannia into mainland Europe for the first time in centuries.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN5_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Karadziordziewic
column2: the Yugoslavic Emperors. When faced with the threat of the Greek Empire steadily conquering the Balkans
column3: a group of small Kingdoms have formed a haphazard military confederation in an attempt to halt it
column4: electing house Karadziordziewic to lead it. To everyone's surprise
column5: their success was overwhelming and soon enough they have retaken all of the Balkans from the Greeks and turned Greece into their tributaries
column6: and turned a haphazard military union into an Empire holding most of the Balkan peninsula. In an attempt to keep their vassals from fighting between each other they have attempted to introduce a new religion into the Balkans
column8: which would incorporate all existing ones. Only time would tell if they succeed.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN6_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Belgium-Oranje-Nassau-Weilburg
column2: who claim to be descendants of not one
column3: but three different pre-event dynasties. Fitting
column5: consisting of three Kingdoms. Catholic Benelux was without a doubt the first true Empire in Post-Event Europe
column6: but soon it has fallen to Numenorian conquests. Despite this
column7: house of Belgium-Oranje-Nassau-Weilburg kept the Imperial seat by converting and becoming vassals of the High King. They have kept this position throughout all of Numenor's history
column8: until it's recent collapse. After the collapse
column9: independent Benelux would emerge as a power again
column10: but it was soon shattered in a succession crisis.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN7_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Bonaparte
column2: the Numernoran High Kings. The founder
column4: was the first High King of Numernor and the founder of the Novelist faith
column5: who dominated Western Europe for centuries. Although their Empire was great
column6: it has overtime started to crumble to pieces
column7: before finally shattering into many warring states under the British invasion
column8: with the former High King's line reduced to just dukes. Nonetheless
column9: they had forever influenced the history of Western Europe and left a lasting legacy.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN8_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Narasimha
column2: a dynasty which rose to prominence by subjugating the deccan plateau under the pretense of forming a large defensive confederation
column3: their plans for Imperial rule fell apart when the throne was inherited by a child.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN9_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Stovbur
column2: Kings of Ruthenia. Founder of the dynasty
column4: was originally a warchief ruling in the city of Poltava
column5: just one of many in completely disorganized region of eastern Europe. He though
column7: accumulated enough power to steamroll through his neighbours
column8: unifying what once was known as Ukraine under his firm rule. In two generations his descendants
column11: largest Eastern European state since the Event. However their advances were halted when Adriana
column13: defeated and slayed Tsisar Bohdan in the battle of Adessa. After that Ruthenia had split between Bohdans two sons
column14: Panas becoming Korol of Ukraine under now dominant Nistrenian Empire and Roman escaping into Belarus
column15: halting Transnistria's advances to the north.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN10_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Dragos. House Dragos managed to restore much of the fallen Transnistrian Empire
column2: though even by 2555 their hold on the throne is tenuous at best
column3: with both their vassals and externals forces putting the Empire’s survival in jeopardy.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN11_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Aleliunas. The rulers of this Dynasty reclaimed the lands of Lithuania under their rule
column2: making it the major force in the East in the name of the resurfaced Romuva faith. Spreading their power West they came into conflict with the Christians. After a long back and forth that at times saw Catholicism on the brink of destruction
column3: they were however driven to extinction by the allied forces of Catholics and Orthodox faithful

column1: DYN12_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House al-Saud. This ancient House dating back to before the Event survived thanks to its many scions
column2: and rebuild its power from scratch once the dust of the Apocalypse settled. However
column3: by 2555 their Kingdom has broken apart after the previous ruler died in war and its closest relative started vying for control.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN13_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Davidic. House Davidic descends from David I
column2: the man that allegedly singlehandedly led the defense of Jerusalem from an invading army. Recognized as the Messiah despite many doubts among the Jewish communities both in other parts of Israel and outside
column3: David I however managed to hold his control over the region and eventually form a Kingdom that survives under his family’s rule to 2555.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN14_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Zollern
column2: who attempted to restore the ancient lands of Kingdom of Prussia. Although initially successful and ready to venture into Eastern Europe to restore Prussia proper
column3: they have suffered a humiliating defeat in the battle for Danzig
column4: forced to abandon their plans for conquest. Soon
column5: their realm would crumble to pieces as they were forced into defensive in attempts to keep Prussia from being erased from the map.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DYN15_DESC;With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Arindi
column2: A dynasty originating from the city of Mumbai
column3: the Lashkandradi claimed descent from the great Ioannes Karasci
column4: the liberator of the Yunani and the first king of Yunakshetra. The dynasty rose to prominence when an adventurer known as Sikandar raised an army and managed to defeat and kill the Vahana ruler of Rajasthan. Soon
column5: Laskandar subjugated the realms of Gujarat and the Indus river by force
column6: and obtained overlordship over Ajmer by supporting a rival claimant to the throne. While Laskandar's achievements were impressive
column7: they were ultimately undone when he died at a young age
column8: leaving a mere child as his heir. Former generals
column10: and subordinate kings refused to acknowledge the child-heir
column11: while each attempted to claim Laskandar's empire for his own. House Mumbaikar was eventually reduced to merely ruling a few square miles of territory by 2555.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
